CatDescriptText: Abner Roberts, stock clerk, 6558 Rowan Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 8, 1959, pg. B1 with question: "Do you believe the John James Racket Squad is driving the numbers racket out of Pittsburgh?" answer reads: "I don't know how far he's going towards driving them out, but I do think that he's making them take cover. The raids are making it harder to play the numbers and tend to make the people more careful.  As a result, the numbers players tend to forget about playing."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Abner Roberts wearing moustache and long sleeved striped shirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Thrift Drugs and Kappels in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
